dialogueText: When the Sphinx lies defeated, the door it had been guarding swings open.
You peer through, into what looks like darkness beyond.
Ummm... Perhaps I shouldn't go in there, Dreamer?
Maybe this is something important that only you and Aurora should see...
I agree, Dreamer. It would be better if Robin stayed behind.
But won't Robin be useful in there? And what if the tower tries to attack her.
I can seal her in this room and she can prop this door open and follow us if needs be.
We shouldn't need her bow from now on.
Don't worry about me, Dreamer. Go on and see whatever it is Aurora wants you to see.
Very well.
With a nod to Robin, you enter the darkened doorway...
Passing beyond you find more stone steps, curving ever downwards.
Though, strangely, the walls of the tower descend for twenty or thirty feet before being swallowed in darkness...
And yet the steps themselves remain brightly lit. You can't see a light source.
And there is nothing in the middle of the tower except a plunging hole.
It's as if the stairs are suspended in mid air, in an inky void of blackness.
Do you really have to go down there?
Watch your step, Dreamer. The stairs are wide, but it can be disorienting from here on.
Swallowing your fear as best you can, you begin to descend the steps.
Robin is quickly left behind, though you hear her voice calling from above:
Good luck, Dreamer! Whatever it is you're doing!
If only you knew, yourself...
At least there don't seem to be any guardians down here. The sphinx seems to have been the last of them.
You descend into the darkness, your path always lit, yet the surroundings not.
It seems to go on for hours...
Aurora follows behind you, but neither of you speak. Something about this place makes talking feel odd.
The further you go, the stranger you feel. You begin to feel light headed. Eventually, your eyes begin to play tricks on you.
In the darkness you start to see shapes... patterns and colours, geometric shapes and lines.
I see them, too, Dreamer.
I call them 'figments'.
We are close to the barrier, here. I think that's what causes them...
The barrier to what?
To the underworld, Dreamer...
All of a sudden, a vision assails you.
What is this place?
A room? With a desk and books and... a typwriter?
What is this place?
There is a picture frame with an image in it. You can't quite make out who is in the image, but something about them is familiar...
As quickly as it came the vision begins to fade.
When you return, you find Aurora holding onto you, keeping you upright. It seems she can touch things again, at least...
Dreamer?
Are you okay? You nearly fell!
What would happen if you fell into that darkness?
You shudder and find you'd rather not think about that...
What happened, Dreamer? You look like you've seen a ghost...
You saw... something...
A vision perhaps?
What was it a vision of, Dreamer?
It's very important you tell me.
You relate exactly what you saw.
What does she think it means?
Aurora looks confused.
I... I don't know...
Does she really not know? Or is she just keeping things from you again?
I'm sorry, Dreamer... I honestly don't know, but I'm worried it is related to... something I can't tell you.
Why can't she tell you?
Because it isn't safe.
Safe for who?
For me.
Please, it isn't out of selfishness that I can't tell you! My life would be in danger if I told you - and that would mean Phantasia itself is in danger.
And she can't tell you why?
No...
Just wait a little longer, please, Dreamer. We're almost there.
There is a strong buzzing in your ears. It has been growing in volume for a while, but you have only just noticed it.
When you look around, you see the lights gathering around you like moths to a flame!
What's going on? What are they doing?
You don't know, but you strongly feel they mean you harm!
You summon your heroes!
스핑크스의 모습이 서서히 흩어진다. 그 뒤로 언제 열렸는지 모를 문이 보였다.
문 너머에는 빛 한 점 보이지 않는 어둠이 짙게 깔려있었다.
... 후. 힘든 전투였어요. 그렇죠?
죄송하지만 저는 여기서 잠깐 재정비할 시간이 필요할 것 같아요, 꿈꾸는 자.
탑의 어둠은 탑이 수용하는 사람만 받아들일 수 있어요. 로빈 씨의 말대로 그녀는 이곳에 남는 것이 좋겠어요.
오로라가 작은 등불을 만들어 로빈에게 건네주었다.
이 방으로 들어오는 출입문은 마법으로 막아둘게요. 이 등불을 들고 있으면 탑의 수호자들이 당신을 인식하지 못할 거예요.
필요하다면 저쪽의 문을 열어요, 로빈. 저와 문을 연결해 놓을게요. 제가 어디에 있든, 문을 열면 제가 있는 곳으로 나오실 수 있도록이요.
좋아요, 오로라. 너무 걱정하지 말고 다녀오세요, 꿈꾸는 자.
정말 괜찮을까, 자꾸만 뒤를 돌아보니 로빈이 내 등을 떠밀었다.
문밖으로 한걸음 나서나 새카만 어둠 속에 잠겨있던 계단이 희미한 빛을 내며 떠올랐다.
계단은 나선을 그리며 아래를 향해 뻗어있었다.
원래부터 그곳에 계단이 있었다기보다는, 내가 내려가는 걸음에 맞춰서 새로 생겨나는 것 같았다.
가까운 곳에 있는 계단보다 저 멀리 아래쪽에 있는 계단이 더 밝게 빛나고 있었다.
그 불빛만이 이정표가 되어주었다.
아래로 향할수록 탑의 벽면이 좁아진다는 느낌이 들었지만, 진짜인지는 확인할 수 없었다.
손을 뻗으면 닿을 것 같은 곳에 벽이 있었지만 막상 뻗어보면 저만큼 멀어졌기 때문이다.
조심하세요, 꿈꾸는 자. 아래쪽으로 떨어지면 아무리 저라도 당신을 찾아낼 수 없을 거예요.
오로라가 신중한 목소리로 말했다.
등 뒤에서 문이 닫히는 소리가 작게 들려온다.
당신은 늘 옳은 길을 선택했죠, 이번에도 그럴 수 있으리라 믿어요. 나중에 만나요, 꿈꾸는 자!
문 닫히는 소리가 사라지기 전, 로빈이 씩씩한 목소리로 외치는 것이 들렸다.
로빈에게 대답해 주고 싶었지만, 뒤를 돌아보기도 전에 문이 큰 소리를 내며 닫혔다.
계단은 여기까지 내려오라는 듯, 나를 부르는 것처럼 빛을 내뿜고 있다.
어쩐지 오로라가 내뿜은 빛과 비슷하다는 생각이 들었다.
무엇이든 치유할 수 있는 따뜻한 빛, 비타의 빛과는 또 다른...
그 빛이 없다면 어디가 위이고 어디가 아래인지 알 수 없으리라.
우리는 한참을 아래쪽으로 걸어 내려갔다. 어둠 속에서 별빛 같은 것이 희미하게 보였다.
이 어둠을 잘 기억해 두세요, 꿈꾸는 자. 드림리스 네더의 공허와 비슷한 구조로 되어 있거든요.
드림리스 네더의 공허가 심연을 닮았다면, 이 어둠은 안식을 닮았어요.
저는 이 어둠을 몽상이라 부른답니다. 자, 거의 다 왔어요. 이제 곧 장벽에 도착할 거예요.
장벽?
네, 당신을 기다리고 있는... 판타지아의 시작이라고 할 수 있는 곳. 그곳의 입구예요.
그 순간, 갑자기 눈 뒤쪽으로 새하얀 빛이 파고들었다.
빛 속에서 희미한 형체들이 서서히 떠오른다.
그건 꼭 가장 처음 메르헨을 소환했을 때를 떠올리게 했다.
잡힐 듯 잡히지 않는 것들.
꿈, 혹은 허상이라고 생각했던 이야기 속의 영웅들이 눈앞에 나타날 때와 비슷한 감각.
번진 형체들은 곧 어떤 풍경이 되었다.
한 번도 본 적 없는 것들인데, 그리운 생각이 들었다. 어쩌면 나는 이 풍경 속에서 태어난 것이 아닐까?
어지러웠다. 아무렇게나 널려있던 책과 낡은 타자기의 잔상이 눈꺼풀 뒤에 달라붙어 떨어지지 않는다. 방금... 뭐였지?
... 꿈꾸는 자? 꿈꾸는 자!
괜찮으세요? 갑자기 쓰러지셔서...
오로라는 내가 일어날 수 있도록 손을 잡아주었다.
다리에 힘이 잘 들어가지 않는다. 방금, 그건...
왜 그러세요, 꿈꾸는 자? 꼭 귀신이라도 본 사람처럼...
내가 뭔가를 본 것 같아.
낡은 타자기, 아무렇게나 쌓인 책들, 책상... 그리고 책상에 놓인 사진 속의 웃고 있던 누군가.
그건...
월드 스톤이나 메르헨들이 당신에게 보여주던 환영과 비슷하던가요?
정확하게 말할 수는 없지만...
그런 것과는 좀 다른 느낌이었다.
어떤 메르헨과 관련된 일인지도 정확하게 알 수 없었다.
그렇군요... 너무 걱정하지 마세요, 꿈꾸는 자. 짐작 가는 것이 있으니까요.
짐작 가는 일?
네, 이 탑 안에서 누군가의 정신에 간섭해 환영을 보여줄 수 있는 존재라면... 하나밖에 없어요.
오로라가 말한 판타지아의 시작과 관련된 무언가일까.
네, 꿈꾸는 자. 지금은 그렇게밖에 말씀드릴 수 없어요.
오로라는 조금 슬픈 표정으로 그렇게 대답했다.
제가 말씀드렸죠, 많이 알면 알수록 당신의 생각과 의지에 더 쉽게 개입할 수 있게 된다고...
생각이라는 것은 한번 떠오르면 사라지지 않아요. 불을 끄고 켜는 것처럼 마음대로 제어할 수 없죠. 저는 당신을 믿지만, 이건 그 이상의 문제에요.
이야기를 마친 오로라가 놀란 표정으로 뒤를 돌아본다.
... 근처까지 왔어요, 꿈꾸는 자. 조심하세요.
앞으로 점점 더 심해질 거예요. 본 것들을 다시 떠올리지 않도록 노력해 주세요. 그것이 당신을 부르고 있어요.
먼 곳에서 무언가 거대한 건물이 무너지는 것 같은 소리가 들려온다.
발자국 소리와도 비슷했다. 희미한 빛무리들이 천장의 자그마한 틈으로 쏟아져 들어온다.
탑의 수호자들이 여기까진 어떻게...!
틈 사이로 아래를 내려다보는 무언가와 눈이 마주친 것 같다는 생각이 들었다.
기이하게 생긴 수호자들이 나와 오로라를 붙잡으려는 듯 쏟아져 내려온다.
When the Sphinx lies defeated, the door it had been guarding swings open.
You peer through, into what looks like darkness beyond.
Ummm... Perhaps I shouldn't go in there, Dreamer?
Maybe this is something important that only you and Aurora should see...
I agree, Dreamer. It would be better if Robin stayed behind.
But won't Robin be useful in there? And what if the tower tries to attack her.
I can seal her in this room and she can prop this door open and follow us if needs be.
We shouldn't need her bow from now on.
Don't worry about me, Dreamer. Go on and see whatever it is Aurora wants you to see.
Very well.
With a nod to Robin, you enter the darkened doorway...
Passing beyond you find more stone steps, curving ever downwards.
Though, strangely, the walls of the tower descend for twenty or thirty feet before being swallowed in darkness...
And yet the steps themselves remain brightly lit. You can't see a light source.
And there is nothing in the middle of the tower except a plunging hole.
It's as if the stairs are suspended in mid air, in an inky void of blackness.
Do you really have to go down there?
Watch your step, Dreamer. The stairs are wide, but it can be disorienting from here on.
Swallowing your fear as best you can, you begin to descend the steps.
Robin is quickly left behind, though you hear her voice calling from above:
Good luck, Dreamer! Whatever it is you're doing!
If only you knew, yourself...
At least there don't seem to be any guardians down here. The sphinx seems to have been the last of them.
You descend into the darkness, your path always lit, yet the surroundings not.
It seems to go on for hours...
Aurora follows behind you, but neither of you speak. Something about this place makes talking feel odd.
The further you go, the stranger you feel. You begin to feel light headed. Eventually, your eyes begin to play tricks on you.
In the darkness you start to see shapes... patterns and colours, geometric shapes and lines.
I see them, too, Dreamer.
I call them 'figments'.
We are close to the barrier, here. I think that's what causes them...
The barrier to what?
To the underworld, Dreamer...
All of a sudden, a vision assails you.
What is this place?
A room? With a desk and books and... a typwriter?
What is this place?
There is a picture frame with an image in it. You can't quite make out who is in the image, but something about them is familiar...
As quickly as it came the vision begins to fade.
When you return, you find Aurora holding onto you, keeping you upright. It seems she can touch things again, at least...
Dreamer?
Are you okay? You nearly fell!
What would happen if you fell into that darkness?
You shudder and find you'd rather not think about that...
What happened, Dreamer? You look like you've seen a ghost...
You saw... something...
A vision perhaps?
What was it a vision of, Dreamer?
It's very important you tell me.
You relate exactly what you saw.
What does she think it means?
Aurora looks confused.
I... I don't know...
Does she really not know? Or is she just keeping things from you again?
I'm sorry, Dreamer... I honestly don't know, but I'm worried it is related to... something I can't tell you.
Why can't she tell you?
Because it isn't safe.
Safe for who?
For me.
Please, it isn't out of selfishness that I can't tell you! My life would be in danger if I told you - and that would mean Phantasia itself is in danger.
And she can't tell you why?
No...
Just wait a little longer, please, Dreamer. We're almost there.
There is a strong buzzing in your ears. It has been growing in volume for a while, but you have only just noticed it.
When you look around, you see the lights gathering around you like moths to a flame!
What's going on? What are they doing?
You don't know, but you strongly feel they mean you harm!
You summon your heroes!
